description:
True insight into how consumers feel, think, and behave is the foundation of many organizations’ success. This module provides a comprehensive coverage of concepts, tools, and techniques with an emphasis on uncovering, generating, and interpreting business-relevant consumer insights. Topics include consumer needs analysis, consumer learning and information search, consumer decisionmaking,
and social influence. The module is targeted at intellectually motivated students interested in pursuing careers in general management, marketing, entrepreneurship, business consulting, as well as not-forprofit marketing. The format will be action-learning-oriented with many individual exercises and a group project, in addition to more traditional lectures, readings, and case analyses.
title: Consumer Behaviour
